pymlgen.interface.babel.main(input_files)¶
pymlgen.interface.babel.make_inchi_string_from_xyz(xyzfile)¶

This function will make a inchi string from a xyz file with babel as the tools

pymlgen.interface.babel.make_smile_string_from_xyz(xyzfile)¶

This function will make smile string from a xyz file. if more than one xyz file provide, it will return smiles in a list. if one xyz file supplied, it will return the string

pymlgen.interface.babel.xyz_to_mopac_input(xyzfile, mopac_input_file, keyword=None)¶

Convert xyz file to mopac input

Parameters

  • xyzfile – input xyz file

  • mopac_input_file – Mopac input file to be written

  • keyword – this is the keyword for optimizations. This parameter should be a strings of characters which are mopac keywords

Returns

It will not return anything. It will prepare the input file for the purpose given in the keyword. Note that babel will be used to prepare the input(.mop) file.

pymlgen.interface.babel.xyz_to_sdf_file(xyz_input_files, sdf_output_file)¶

class pymlgen.interface.mopac.Mopac(molecule, qc_params)¶

Bases: pymlgen.interface.SF

get_coords()¶
Returns

coords It will return coordinates

get_energy()¶

:return:This object will return energy from a mopac calculation. It will return both the kj/my_mol and kcal/my_mol units.

optimize(max_cycles=350, gamma=0.0, restart=False, convergence='normal')¶

:return:This object will return the optimization status. It will optimize a structure.

prepare_input(keyword='')¶

Create a Mopac input

Parameters

keyword – this is the keyword for optimizations. This parameter should be a strings of characters which are mopac keywords

Returns

exit status.

pymlgen.interface.mopac.main()¶

class pymlgen.interface.turbomole.Turbomole(molecule, qc_params)¶

Bases: pymlgen.interface.SF

optimize(options)¶

This is the python implementation of jobex of turbomole

Returns

Union(True, ‘SCFFailed’, ‘GradFailed’, ‘UpdateFailed’, ‘CycleExceeded’, False)

run_turbomole_jobex(max_cycles=350)¶

Run a turbomole optimisation.

return one of the following: True: converged SCFFailed GradFailed UpdateFailed CycleExceeded False: unknown error or jebex execution error

Return type

string or boolean

pymlgen.interface.turbomole.make_coord(atoms_list, coordinates, output_file='coord')¶

Create a turbomole ‘coord’ file from the provided list of atoms and cartesian coordinates.

pymlgen.interface.turbomole.movie_maker()¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.plot_energy(params)¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.prepare_control(basis='def2-SVP', func='b-p', ri='on', memory=6000, grid='m4', scf_conv=7, scf_maxiter=500, dftd3='yes', charge=0, multiplicity=1, read_define_input='no', coordinates='internal')¶

This function will prepare the control file. Most of the arguments have default values(all have in its current form). The read_define_input var if “yes”, then define_input_file should provide. The define will run from this input file.

pymlgen.interface.turbomole.remove(file_name)¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.remove_data_group(group)¶

similar to turbomole kdg script

pymlgen.interface.turbomole.rewrite_turbomole_energy(total_restraint_energy)¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.rewrite_turbomole_energy_and_gradient_files(number_of_atoms, restraint_energy, restraint_gradients)¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.rewrite_turbomole_gradient(number_of_atoms, restraint_energy, restraint_gradient)¶

Rewrite new gradient file in turbomole format

pymlgen.interface.turbomole.run_single_point()¶

Run a single point calculation

return one of the following: True: SCF Converged False: error

Return type

string or boolean

pymlgen.interface.turbomole.run_turbomole_module(module)¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.safe_rewrite_file(modified_data_groups, file_name)¶
pymlgen.interface.turbomole.sed_inplace(pattern, replace_to, filename='control')¶

Perform the pure-Python equivalent of in-place sed substitution: e.g., sed -i -e ‘s/’${pattern}’/’${replace_to}’ “${filename}”. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4427542/how-to-do-sed-like-text-replace-with-python#4427835
